column1: my:Belonging to or associated with the speaker
myself:Used by a speaker to refer to himself or herself
we:Used by a speaker to refer to himself or herself and one or more other people considered together
our:Belonging to or associated with people in general
ours:Used to refer to a thing or things belonging to or associated with the speaker and one or more other people previously mentioned or easily identified
ourselves:We or us personally
you:Used to refer to the person or people that the speaker is addressing
your:Belonging to or associated with any person in general
yours:Used to refer to a thing or things belonging to or associated with the person or people that the speaker is addressing
yourself:You personally
yourselves:You personally
him:Used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to a male person or animal previously mentioned or easily identified
his:Belonging to or associated with a male person or animal previously mentioned or easily identified
himself:Used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to a male person or animal previously
she:Used to refer to a woman
column3: or female animal previously mentioned or easily identified

column1: her:Used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to a female person or animal previously
hers:Used to refer to a thing or things belonging to or associated with a female person or animal previously mentioned
herself:Used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to a female person or animal previously mentioned
itself:Used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to a thing or animal previously mentioned
they:Used to refer to two or more people or things previously mentioned or easily identified
them:Used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to two or more people or things previously mentioned
their:Belonging to or associated with the people or things previously mentioned or easily identified
theirs:Used to refer to a thing or things belonging to or associated with two or more people or things previously mentioned
themselves:Used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to a group of people or things previously mentioned
what:Asking for information specifying something
which:Asking for information specifying one or more people or things from a definite set
whom:Used instead of ‘who’ as the object of a verb or preposition
this:Used to identify a specific person or thing close at hand or being indicated or experienced
that:Used to identify a specific person or thing observed or heard by the speaker
these:Plural form of this
those:Plural form of that
the:Denoting one or more people or things already mentioned or assumed to be common knowledge
and:Used to connect words of the same part of speech
column4: that are to be taken jointly

column1: if:Introducing a conditional clause
because:For the reason that
until:Up to (the point in time or the event mentioned)
of:Expressing the relationship between a part and a whole
for:In support of or in favour of (a person or policy)
with:Accompanied by (another person or thing)
against:In opposition to
into:Expressing movement or action with the result that someone or something becomes enclosed or surrounded by something else
during:Throughout the course or duration of (a period of time)
to:Expressing motion in the direction of (a particular location)
from:Indicating the point in space at which a journey
when:At what time
where:In or to what place or position
how:In what way or manner; by what means
nor:literary term for neither
than:introducing the second element in a comparison
should:Used to indicate obligation
